newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-TAYLOR IN THE RUNS AGAIN AS AUSTRALIA BEAT NORTHANTS.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-TAYLOR IN THE RUNS AGAIN AS AUSTRALIA BEAT NORTHANTS.

text.p: Australia captain Mark Taylor gave himself another confidence booster when he top-scored with 76 as the tourists beat Northamptonshire in a rain-affected one-day match on Saturday.
Taylor, who has acknowledged that failure in the upcoming Ashes test series against England would probably cost him his job, set Australia on their way to a total of 232 from 47.4 overs.
He shared a solid opening partnership with Michael Slater (33) and also added runs with Mark Waugh (38) before finally falling lbw.
Reserve wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist hit a crisp 40 as Australia, who face England in the first one-day international next week, amassed a commanding total in difficult circumstances.

"It wasn't the world's best wicket and I was a bit slow early on but I improved as I went along," Taylor said. "I was concentrating on using this match as practice because I want to make the one-day side (to face England) on merit.
"That's the best my feet have moved for two or three months although there is still room for improvement.
"On Thursday, in the first match against England, I will have to start a bit more positively, but I'm sure I will."
Taylor's 76 came on the back of his 45 in the opening match of the tour at Arundel on Thursday and suggests a much-needed return to form. It was his highest score in any competition for three months.
In reply, Northampton hit 134 for five from 35 overs before rain stopped play. Australia won on a faster run rate.
Northants opener Mal Loye made 65 not out which included a tremendous six over mid-wicket off the leg-spin of Shane Warne, who finished his first match of the tour with figures of two for 21.
